Article 7
Should the Jury consider that the quality of the works sub¬
mitted does not justify the awarding of the Prize, the amount
shall be turned over to a reserve fund.
Article 8
Organizations which have not subscribed the quota required
under Art. 27 of the Italia Prize Statute, cannot be represented
on the Jury and will also forfeit the right to submit entries
to the Italia Prize for Television Competition.
Article 9
Entries submitted to the Italia Prize for Television must
have a minimum duration of 13 minutes and must not exceed 60
minutes.
Article 10
The Jury for the Italia Prize for Television shall be
formed by all the Organizations participating in the Italia
Prize which supply television services and have fulfilled the
conditions laid down by Art. 8 of this Appendix.
Should there be in any Country more than one Television
Organization, these Organizations may send only one expert
selected by common agreement.
Article 11
Each Organization may submit only one work to the Jury.
Article 12
The decisions of the Jury shall not be valid if at least
half the Representatives plus one of the Organizations partici¬
pating, according to Art. 10, are not present.
Should the Jury not attain the said total, it shall be the
Secretariate responsibility to complete it by calling on some
television experts of its choice.
